intro: Orthosia loandensis, commonly known as the Loando orthosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Orthosia loandensis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
